attributes.action: Impose legislation to stop charity bags being delivered to homes in the UK
attributes.background: charitybags.org.uk estimate that 525 million charity bags are delivered to homes in England & Wales per year â€“ this would equate to 2,625 tonnes of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: They say only 3% are filled, meaning that a staggering 509 million bags may be ending up in landfill, contributing to the worldwide plastic problem.

attributes.action: UK Government to Fund Advice Services for British Citizens living in Spain
attributes.background: Citizens Advice Spain is the first stop for thousands of UK Nationals who contact us daily for Advice, Assistance, Information and Guidance. We inform so that the community understand their obligations and rights. We use laws and regulations to assist residents, holiday homeowners and on relocation.
attributes.additional_details: This well known registered Charity was founded in 2014. The Bureau advisers are regularly asked to appear on radio shows. Team members  also host talks for associations, hold seminars and legal clinics. Other organisations including the British consulates in various regions of Spain forward UK Nationals to us for our expertise. Two of the advisers  are registered paralegals and are able to respond to daily questions via the website, emails, phones and legal clinics. www,citizensadvice.org.es

attributes.action: Universal Credit: split payments between adults in each household
attributes.background: The UK Government pays Universal Credit to 1 account per household. Charities have expressed concern this could increase the risk of financial abuse. Payments should be paid to individuals to avoid enabling financial coercion and women being trapped in abusive relationships due to lack of money.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please see:
https://wbg.org.uk/analysis/briefing-papers/briefing-universal-credit-financial-abuse/
or
https://www.buzzfeed.com/emilyashton/this-mp-says-the-governments-own-welfare-system-is-trapping?utm_term=.sfdXrwbQN#.ggkXMWgGB

attributes.action: Pass a law guaranteeing free speech except for incitement to violence
attributes.background: Free speech is the bedrock of western civilisation and should be protected from prosecution. People in the UK should be free to say what they want, when they want and where they want. This should cover all public places and places of employment. The only exception is an incitement to violence.
attributes.additional_details: People should be free to speak their mind at home, in a public space and in a place of employment or worship. Without free speech the evils of society can not be confronted and individual rights can be eroded by the interests of groups.

attributes.action: Ban Aspartame and its associated sweeteners from all food and drinks in the UK
attributes.background: The use of Aspartame and its associated sweeteners are increasingly being linked to many illnesses and medical conditions and even obesity.
attributes.additional_details: Many people use them because of obesity and/or diabetes or to help reduce their sugar and calorie intake. These chemically produced sweeteners are believed to be detrimental to the health and well-being of the population. There are natural alternatives that can be used in place of them.

attributes.action: A final say on the deal negotiated with the EU, with the option to Remain
attributes.background: Leave 'won' the Referendum, but voters have not had the opportuniy of seeing what the alternatives to our current membership of the EU are, and of deciding whether the likely economic, political and social consequences mean that it would be better for the UK to remain full members.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was 'won' on a simple majority because it was said to be Advisory at the time. There was at the time no indication of the type of deal, or relationship, the UK would achieve with the 27 other members of the EU. The government later said it would respect the will of the people: but the people may well have voted differently had they known the result would be considered set in stone (mandatory referendum would require a supermajority.)

attributes.action: Declare the 2016 referendum on membership of the EU null and void.
attributes.background: Under section 3.3 (e) of the CODE OF GOOD PRACTICE ON REFERENDUMS the UK government should declare the result of the 2016 referendum null and void because of the decision by the Electoral Commission that rules on spending were broken and referral to the police has been made.

attributes.action: Scrap NHS surcharge for non EU living in UK who already pay N.I contributions
attributes.background: It has come to the notice of Association of Africans in Scotland (AAS), a charitable organisation that non EU families who legally live, work&pay taxes/N.I in the UK are asked to cough up an additional NHS surcharge (separate from the HO fees&other costs) when they renew their immigration documents
attributes.additional_details: Telegraph of 5 February 2018, reported Health minister saying: "Our NHS is always there when you need it, paid for by British taxpayers. These people, even though non-EU, pay taxes/NI as well which goes into the NHS. AAS believes in the United Kingdom as a country which champions fairness & subjecting applicants who already pay N.I to pay another mandatory NHS surcharge amounts to double taxation & therefore an unfair practice. AAS is therefore calling for a review and scrapping of this charge.

attributes.action: Reject plans to build a massive solar farm on Graveney Marshes in Kent.
attributes.background: Plans are being prepared by developers to build the largest solar farm in the UK on Graveney Marshes adjacent to a SSSI, nature reserve and the Saxon Shore Way. The proposal envisages unsightly 4 metre high solar panels on hundreds of acres of land which would ruin this idyllic area of coastal Kent.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is opposed by the local MP, Helen Whateley as well as Kent Wildlife Trust, the RSPB and the Council for the Protection of Rural England. Local residents are also totally opposed.

As a major national infrastructure project because of its' size, any formal planning application will have to be decided by the Secretary of State.

attributes.action: Review the Animal Welfare Regulations 2018 and DEFRA Guidance notes
attributes.background: New regulations for licensed activities involving animals are coming into force on October 1st. Two activities covered are day care for dogs and home boarding for dogs. The new law is contradictory and unclear in many aspects and will force a large number of home businesses to have to close.
attributes.additional_details: Guidance notes have been issued for councils to use, to enforce the new law but they contradict the legislation in places and there are many grey areas open to interpretation. The guidance notes do not seem to cover all aspects of the regulations, and in other places seem to bear no relevance to the regulations. The guidance seems to be aimed at bigger day care centres and small home businesses will be forced to close. Some have already taken the decision to not apply for a new license at all.

attributes.action: Fund seizure alarms for everyone with Epilepsy
attributes.background: I decided to start this petition after my son, 2 years old, got diagnosed with epilepsy and started to have nocturnal seizures. 1st December 2016 is when it all began with his first seizure - a 4 hour status seizure which resulted in him having to be placed into a coma on life support for 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) is when a person with epilepsy dies suddenly and prematurely, and no other cause of death is found. Around 1,200 people die from Epilepsy each year in the UK. Around half of these deaths are SUDEP (sudden unexpected death in epilepsy). If you have seizures during the night, having a seizure alarm that alerts someone if you have a seizure is a life changer. The Government must provide enough funding for everyone who needs one.

attributes.action: A call from the UK for UN Peace Keeping Force in Southern Cameroon at the UN
attributes.background: There is ongoing violence perpetrated by Government Forces and Southern Cameroonian militants in the English-Speaking part of Cameroon, specifically the North-West and South-West Regions. The UK needs to call for a UN peacekeeping force in Southern Cameroon.
attributes.additional_details: The English speaking part of Cameroon has for over 60 years since joining La Republique du Cameroun been subjected to marginalization and oppression of the Anglo-Saxon culture, which was considered untouchable during the unity of the two Regions to form the Federal Republic of Cameroon. There is the need for meaningful dialogue to resolve the crisis. Without an independent UN Observer to monitor peace and oversee dialogue, we could have a genocide on our hands.

attributes.action: We request a ban on issuing psychiatric drugs to children under 5 years old.
attributes.background: We strongly believe that the risk of potential harm from psychiatric drugs is too great to expose a young childâ€™s brain to this risk. Countries like France have a ban until seven years of age. More research is needed in this field and caution is required until that point.
attributes.additional_details: We are aware that children as young as two could be being medicated with strong drugs designed for adult use, such as psychostimulants, antipsychotics or antidepressants. We have safeguarding concerns about this growing practice. Increasingly Educational Psychologists in the field are aware of such cases and this causes us great concern.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for cystic fibrosis sufferers
attributes.background: Cystic Fibrosis in an incurable condition prodomanantly affecting patients lungs and pancreas, with sufferers often on more then 40 pills a day. CF doesnâ€™t get free prescriptions because when they were introduced sufferers died before 16 but now with better life expectancy they need free medicine .

attributes.action: Reject calls to add American Bulldogs to the dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Peta, an organization that is meant to dedicated to the protection of animals has called on the UK government that it should add American bulldogs to the dda, effectively banning them outright. Breed specific legislation is nout an effective solution. I suggest the law notices deed not breed

attributes.action: Legislate against anyone with EU pension serving in Commons or Lords.
attributes.background: I believe that EU pensions are a clear conflict of interest while leaving the EU. Legislate to make it illegal for anyone receiving or due to receive such a pension from serving in House of Commons or House of Lords.

attributes.action: No cap or limit on compensation for Windrush Generation and their descendants
attributes.background: We want a fair compensation scheme for the Windrush Generation that is in line with compensation awarded by the courts in civil cases. There should be no artificial cap that will inadequately compensate those who have suffered emotionally, financially, lost their homes and citizenship.
attributes.additional_details:
Six months since Windrush Scandal was exposed there has been some progress and numerous apologies from the Prime Minster.The government intend to introduce a cap on all compensation claims despite the fact they did not recognise or consider any interim or hardship fund. The Windrush Generation plus others from the Commonwealth have paid their taxes and contributed to the wealth, prosperity and cultural identity of UK since WW2.The scheme needs to reflect this.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-44888187

attributes.action: Regulate  open air prayer meetings of all denominations
attributes.background: There are now times when roads can be blocked by religious gatherings. This should not be permissible unless special dispensation has been sought and granted.
attributes.additional_details: The blocking of public thoroughfares, whether highways, footpaths or public parks, should be prohibited, except for special occasions when permission has been sought and granted. This should apply to all religions and the use of foreign language prayers (including Latin) should also be prohibited in a public space.

attributes.action: Annul the 2016 EU referendum result due to the overspend by Leave.EU.
attributes.background:
UK is a member of the Venice commission. The Venice commission's Code on referenda states (section 3.3 - Funding, Paragraph 24):

"In the event of a failure to abide by the statutory requirements, for instance if the cap on spending is exceeded by a significant margin, the vote must be annulled."
attributes.additional_details: Leave.EU have been found to have overspent spending limits by at least 10%. This is a clear violation of the Venice Commission and as a result, the Referendum result should be annulled and a new vote called.

attributes.action: Increase maintenance loans to students living in Oxford to London weighting
attributes.background: After being ranked the least affordable city in the UK to live, it would make sense that the government and student finance reflect this fact in the amount of maintenance loan students living in Oxford receive, but they do not. Rent and living costs in Oxford are well above the national average.
attributes.additional_details:
Studying and living in Oxford is financially straining on all students, affecting a students ability to achieve the best grades possible as they have to work long hours in a part time job just to live.

With the added pressure of part-time work, on top of an already strenuous University schedule, a students mental and physical health, alongside grades, can suffer.

The government need to assess the financial situation students within Oxford, as well as other expensive cities and fix the issue.

attributes.action: Fund afamelanotide on the NHS to treat erythropoietic protoporphyria
attributes.background: Erythropoietic Protoporphyria is a life changing genetic condition, your body has a reaction when exposed to UV and visible light. You can't go out without covering head to toe, just to be able to leave the house. Inside all blinds must be closed, also lights to be checked. No prevention or cure.
attributes.additional_details:
Reactions mean weeks of agony. You feel like your blood is on fire, pain beyond words that no medication touches. Skin dries and cracks. You canâ€™t talk, eat, and  struggle to drink. It can also lead to liver failure and Vitamin D and iron deficiencies. 
 
There is a treatment that works and other countries are using it but NICE has said no, because itâ€™s too expensive. We are pleading for the government to fund this treatment and give EPP sufferers a chance of a normal life

attributes.action: Outdoor nature-based learning to be compulsory and weekly in all English schools
attributes.background: We believe that not enough children of all ages are being exposed to weekly outdoor sessions in all seasons and all weathers, connecting with nature and involved with sustainability, knowing practical ways to care and protect the world they live in
attributes.additional_details: This campaign is led by a forest school leader.

attributes.action: Provide free sanitary products to young women receiving free school meals
attributes.background: Recent media reports have highlighted issues relating to what is being described as period poverty. 137,700 UK girls miss school each year in addition to putting their health at risk trying to manage without these essential items. Cannock Soroptimists believe funding is needed to end period poverty.
attributes.additional_details: SI Cannock have established that this is both a local and national issue. The following links provide further information:- https://www.always.co.uk/en-gb/about-us/endperiodpoverty http://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-03-15/period-poverty-the-women-forced-to-choose-between-food-and-sanitary-products/ https://inews.co.uk/inews-lifestyle/women/period-poverty-girls-toilet-roll-afford-tampons/

attributes.action: Create an independent Ombudsman to investigate & regulate Vet companies
attributes.background:
There is no Ombudsman for Vet Practices in the UK that is independent and external.

We have Ombudsman for communication, gas, electricity, NHS. When a consumer of a Vets company raises a complaint about a Vet company (not a vet) there is no Ombudsman for when things go wrong.
attributes.additional_details: There has been many cases in the press and complaints online of vet practices charging extortionate prices for out of hours treatment on their beloved pet. Vet companies can charge what they like, act how they like and time and time again get away with this leaving the consumer at the mercy of out of hours when their pet is injured or seek emergency treatment.

attributes.action: Debate a â€˜National Strategy to Promote the Switch to Cloth Nappies.â€™
attributes.background: More families would switch to cloth with sufficient information and a financial incentive. Ringfence money so councils can effectively promote cloth through well resourced libraries, liaison with antenatal/ postnatal services and incentives. Hold manufacturers of disposable accountable to help fund.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK, app 8 million nappies are thrown daily; app 3% of our household waste* (app. half a million tons, annually)**. One baby will produce app. 1 ton of waste*** which takes > 200 years to biodegrade. Disposable nappies also have greater environmental costs due to the production process. Those who use cloth tend to switch to reuseable wipes and bags, further reducing use of single use items.
Councils pay Â£88.95 p/tonne, in landfill tax.
*Veolia ** recyclingexpert.co.uk
*** kickscount.org.uk

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence for a parent to deny contact after a court order
attributes.background: Currently there is nothing preventing a parent from not abiding to a court access order, meaning the non resident parent will have to repeatedly return to court to have it enforced. This has a negative emotional impact on both the parent and children. It's also time consuming and very costly.
attributes.additional_details: The police agree this happens too often, but they cant help because it is not a criminal offence, and can only advise returning to court, but unfortunately this can become a never ending cycle . Some parents even go as far as trying to cut the other parent out Completely, which is known as parental alienation. Research is being done on the negative emotional impact losing time with a loving parent has on children, and the law needs to be updated to reflect this and protect children and families.

attributes.action: All children's bicycles sold in the UK to have handlebar plugs fitted.
attributes.background: Children are injured, and even killed, by the handlebars of their own bikes. These deaths are preventable. I would like to update British Standards. Initially through an immediate voluntary action and then into BS EN 16054 (BMX) & BS EN ISO 8098 (childrens').
attributes.additional_details: Bicycle handlebar trauma has been well documented in children. Spleen, liver, pancreatic lacerations and renal injuries are the most commonly traumatized sites. Other reported injuries are traumatic abdominal wall hernias and ruptures, aortic rupture, transection of the common bile duct, traumatic arterial occlusion, and groin injuries Presumably, the handlebar of a typical child's bicycle acts as a spear, concentrating what may be a relatively small amount of energy into a focal point of injury.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of the meningitis Acwy vaccine to 3months
attributes.background: In November 2017 we lost our 10 month old daughter to meningitis W which is something no one gets a vaccine against until they are roughly 14. The only way to get this vaccine is to pay privately, which can cost about Â£200.
attributes.additional_details:
If this vaccine had been available maybe my little Lily would still be with all her family today. I donâ€™t know what else to do other than try and look at getting the age reduced to try and prevent this happening to any other people. All please sign and share. There is probably plenty of other petitions going around for this but the more there is we stand more of a chance 
Thank you

attributes.action: Commission a statue of Enoch Powell to be placed outside Parliament
attributes.background: In light of the contribution made to the UK by his actions in Parliament and in the Armed Forces we urge that a stature of Enoch Powell is commissioned and placed outside Parliament to honour his dedication to his country.

attributes.action: Overturn a Home Office decision regarding a Kidney Donor who was refused a visa
attributes.background:
Gulfraz Ahmed, 33 of Luton is in need of a life saving kidney transplant.

Throughout his life he has suffered many serious health issues. By the age of 12 both his kidney's had deteriorated. His mother had provided a life saving kidney donor at the time, which has so far kept him going until now.
attributes.additional_details:
Gulfraz's only kidney has now deteriorated to the point he requires dialyses 3 times a week. This is costing the NHS Â£50,000 a year.

Gulfraz's family have found a match after extensive tests in Pakistan. All that is required is a 6 months visa to accommodate this transplant.

However the application has been refused by the Home Office.

We are seeking the Home Office to display compassion on the grounds to save a young successful business man's life. Sadly this is a matter of life or death.

attributes.action: Georgiaâ€™s law: Require stay drug safe measures and testing at all festivals
attributes.background: Georgia Jones died at Mutiny festival May 26th 2018 after taking two pills. All festivals should have drug safe measures. Alongside security checks and dogs, there should be clear warning signs of potential side effects. Front of house testing would also give more information to the individuals.
attributes.additional_details: Research has proven that all these measures do help and make people think twice, with half choosing not to take. Searches do not stop drugs getting in. Education and advice is what is needed.

attributes.action: Stop UK coastal crude oil pollution threat; ban Colter offshore oil rig.
attributes.background: The oil rig four miles off Bournemouth beach must be stopped and the Government should commit to a permanent ban on all offshore drilling in the area. Bournemouth, Poole and the wider coastal area is reliant on tourism and the natural beauty of the coast.
attributes.additional_details: A blowout could result in 20,000,000 gallons of leaked oil over thousands of square miles, devastating UK coasts, and their economies. Drilling offshore Bournemouth is a reckless gamble with our precious coastlines. It does not meet ALARP (as low as reasonably practicable) principles because there is an alternative - a nearby land-based extended reach drilling facility, where an oil spill could be contained and considerably reduced compared to a subsea leak directly into the sea.

attributes.action: Stop Postal Votes except for the elderly and disabled
attributes.background:
There is too much fraudulent use of Postal Votes.
Some people even sell theirs and this produces an unfair advantage. We must maintain a level playing field.

attributes.action: New independent complaints & monitoring body for schools & local authorities
attributes.background: Legislation and DfE guidance state how schools and local authorities must comply with the law. If statutory guidance or duties are not followed, enforcement is left to solo families using ineffective complaint procedures, or the LGO service, which wonâ€™t act in the face of ultra vires local policies.
attributes.additional_details: This problem often relates to SEN support, mental or physical illness provision, bullying, or disability discrimination. The lack of accountability in the system creates severe difficulties for families & denies many children the support & education they need. â€˜Not Fine in Schoolâ€™ call for a new independent, transparent & objective body to enable a fair complaints process, which is NOT investigated by the complained of services. This body must be empowered to monitor practices & instigate consequences when schools or local authorities use local (invalid) policies, or act in an ultra vires way.

attributes.action: Decriminalise, legalise and regulate cannabis for medicinal and recreational use
attributes.background:
The use of illegal drugs, impacts on the social and economic well being of the country, including its reputation overseas. 

The Governmentâ€™s organised crime strategy sets out that drug trafficking to the UK costs an estimated Â£10.7 billion per year. (National Crime Agency, 2018).
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is still the most widely used illegal drug in the UK and the UK wholesale cannabis market is worth almost Â£1 billion a year. The NCA estimates that 270 tonnes of cannabis is needed to satisfy annual UK user demand. (National Crime Agency, 2018).

www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk

The number of arrests and court cases associated with cannabis-related offences have declined substantially in the states that have legalized cannabis. (World Drug Report, 2016). 

www.unodc.org/wdr2016/

attributes.action: Require political parties to have robust procedures for tackling discrimination
attributes.background: Traditionally, British political parties are regulated only by the electorate, apart from basic rules on matters such as campaign funding which are enforced by the Electoral Commission. There are no rules against discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
It is clear that political parties are not trusted to deal with discrimination themselves. For example, our polling has found that 92% of British Jews feel that UK political parties tolerate antisemitism.

The law should require political parties to have fair, efficient and transparent procedures for tackling discrimination amongst members, or the parties should face substantial fines.

Political parties should be obliged to meet a minimum requirement for tackling discrimination of all forms, including antisemitism, based on the Campaign Against Antisemitismâ€™s guidance at https://antisemitism.uk/politics/manifesto.

attributes.action: Stop sex offenders being held at Hollesley Bay prison
attributes.background: Hollesley bay is an open prison with a public access road right through its grounds. There is a primary school within a 4 minute walk and areas open to the public where people take their children to play.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glyphosate in the UK
attributes.background:
Since classified a probable carcinogen, many are saying NO to glyphosate.

Why not prove chemicals safe before allowing use? 

UK GOV If you take your duty of care seriously, you would ban it now, pending review, as there is no proof it does not cause illnesses & mounting evidence it does.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is on behalf of â€˜Against Glyphosate Europeâ€™ - A networking, solidarity and information exchange group for European based campaigners wanting to effect Glyphosate bans. (Can be found on facebook)

Reasons to ban: 

1)	Dewayne Johnson against Monsanto - www.theguardian.com/business/2018/aug/11/one-mans-suffering-exposed-monsantos-secrets-to-the-world

2)	WHO: â€˜probably carcinogenicâ€™ 

3)	Glyphosate can cause cancer: www.euronews.com/2016/07/01/glyphosate-can-cause-cancer

4) Many countries banning it

Too many more to list - do your research

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of lee sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again.  No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denining it.

attributes.action: Criminalise the export of cannabis
attributes.background: The government contradicts itself by telling the public that cannabis should not be legalised as it has no medicinal benefit however the United Kingdom is the biggest exporter of cannabis in the world. If it's illegal to sell on the streets it should be illegal to sell overseas.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for ticket resales to be more than 10% of Face Value
attributes.background: Today, May 1st 2018, we waited patiently to buy one of 90,000 tickets available for a London NFL game on Ticketmaster. Within the space of five minutes, they were sold out and available on other sites such as Viagogo for more than four times their face value.
attributes.additional_details: For example, we have paid Â£170 each for tickets which, through Ticketmaster, should have cost us Â£41 each. This is not just making a profit, this is theft. It is taking advantage of people who are desperate to see their idols, to experience something for the first time ever, who have worked exceptionally hard towards.

attributes.action: Cancel Donald Trumpâ€™s visit to the U.K. due to the immigrant children scandal
attributes.background:
News and photographs are now everywhere regarding the new zero tolerance policy which has seen children as young as 12 months old taken from their parents at the border and placed alone into â€˜detention centresâ€™ and camps.
The British govt. must take a stand against this or we appear to condone it.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2018/06/16/america-is-better-than-this-what-a-doctor-saw-in-a-texas-shelter-for-migrant-children/?utm_term=.150870f3644a

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/05/world/americas/us-un-migrant-children-families.html

attributes.action: Any parent convicted of a child sexual offence to be stripped of parental rights
attributes.background: As it stands both parents have joint parental rights and responsibilities of their children if born from 2003 whether married or not.
attributes.additional_details: Convicted Paedophiles and sex offenders with children born from 2003 still have legal rights and responsibilities over their children. This needs to change as no parent or guardian should have to fight in a family court to have those right revoked.

attributes.action: Close the loophole that allows second home owners to evade council tax and rates
attributes.background:
In England, second home owners can avoid council tax by claiming to be a business if they say they are available for letting for 140 days a year - they do not have to actually let at all.
As their rateable value is below Â£12k, they also qualify for 100% small business rate relief - so pay nothing.
attributes.additional_details:
In Southwold, on the Suffolk coast, where most houses are second homes, this loophole costs the local council about half a million pounds every year in lost revenue because 257 of these homes claim to be a business and pay nothing. 
It is grossly unfair that people with two homes should be subsidized by people with no, or only one, home.
Most genuine businesses do not now qualify for small business rate relief because the latest revaluation has put them above the ceiling.

attributes.action: Total ban on killing and eating of dogs and cats in uk
attributes.background: Total ban and new legislation to make the killing of cats and dogs for the purpose of food consumption illegal in the UK. The current law is that it is illegal to sell dog meat through licensed channels to the public, but actually eating dog and cat meat is not a specifically banned practice in UK.
attributes.additional_details: Daily mail article dated 6th August 2018

attributes.action: Remove the requirement to pay VAT by churches, specifically on building works.
attributes.background: 20% VAT is payable on extensions and refurbishments by churches (and other bodies) which are being undertaken for local communities, many in deprived areas and the amount taken from any funds raised by the churches makes it, in a lot if instances, difficult to carry out all the work required.
attributes.additional_details: Our church in Denton undertook a refurbishment in 2005 which brought many people & groups into the church & its premises, at a time when councils were closing facilities. Churches help by housing groups that otherwise would have to close, or at least restrict the work that they do. This type of includes working with various health groups, places for the young and old to meet, and much more. We are looking at a Â£1,000,000 project which incurs Â£200k in tax, this mean much of it will not be done.

attributes.action: Issue an RAF centenary medal to all serving RAF personnel.
attributes.background: The RAF celebrates its centenary year in 2018 and given its illustrious past and its continued contribution to the safety and security of the United Kingdom, a centenary medal should be issued to all serving members of the RAF who achieve permanent service within the Royal Air Force during 2018.

attributes.action: FA2017 Part 2 Clause 29(2) to include calorific maltodextrin
attributes.background: Calorific maltodextrin has high GI but not included as sugars. Consumers are misled as to amount of sugars in drinks where glycemic maltodextrin not included.  Sugar drinks levy should take account of all glycemic carbohydrates

attributes.action: Stop UK government funding the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."
attributes.background: Major questions have been raised about the actions of the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for domesticated cats and dogs to be spayed/neutered.
attributes.background: Not spaying/neutering pets has caused shelters to be full to capacity.,therefore there are many strays and feral animals on the streets, struggling  to survive with little help.
